definition: to hand over/to explain/to make clear/to brief (sb)/to account for/to justify oneself/to confess/(coll.) to finish

sentences.english: It seems that you love doing black & white photography, Please explain why.

sentences.english: The police caught him and he made a clean breast of his crime.
sentences.chinese: 警察抓住了他，他坦白交代了他的罪行。

sentences.english: Metasomatism of the granitic rocks in Zhejiang Province, China is investigated by petrography.

sentences.english: The first chapter briefly introduces the syllabary of Chaohu dialect and states the research methods and procedures of the experiments.

sentences.english: Such inspection shall be conducted in the presence of the diplomatic agent or of his authorized representative.

sentences.english: We have to have complete clarity on that issue.

sentences.english: He clammed up when I asked him who else was involved.

definition: to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back
to find out/to ascertain/to get to the bottom of/to clarify
to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
to investigate and find out/to ascertain
